definition: to be fond of eating/to be gluttonous
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
happy to partake but not prepared to do any work (idiom)/all take and no give

sentences.english: No ice cream in the world is more delicious than American ice cream.
sentences.chinese: 世界上沒有哪個地方的冰激淋比美國的更好吃了。

sentences.english: Southerners are not tasty pasta, shepherd's purse are mostly used for Shao Tang eat.
sentences.chinese: 南方人不好吃麪食的，薺菜大多用來燒湯喫。

sentences.english: That braised lobster is just delicious.
sentences.chinese: 那道紅燒小龍蝦真的太好吃了。

sentences.english: To do so, congee is delicious, and the nutritional content of rice which had been reduced.
sentences.chinese: 這樣做，粥是好吃了，米里面的營養成分卻減少了。

sentences.english: The french toast was so delicious, I might go there again tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 法國吐司太好吃了，明天我可能會再去。

sentences.english: Some Korean dishes are savagely good.
sentences.chinese: 一些韓餐真的是太他媽好吃了。

sentences.english: The food here is terrific. I love it. it's out of this world.
sentences.chinese: 這裏的東西太好吃了，我喜歡，簡直是天下第一。

sentences.english: The hamburger I bought was so good that I just scoffed it straight down in three bites.
sentences.chinese: 我買的漢堡包太好吃了，我狼吞虎嚥三下就搞掂了。

sentences.english: And the cheese cake was heavenly; I had to have 2 pieces of it.
sentences.chinese: 奶油蛋糕真是太好吃了，所以我吃了兩塊。

sentences.english: I could eat this all day.
Steamed dumpling filled with savoury mince, a Chinese rissole, too good.
sentences.chinese: 充滿了味道濃郁的細碎肉的蒸餃，太好吃了。
